taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits all sections of the river from the fast flowing upper sections to the slower moving lower reaches.  Collected between 2 and 1150 m elevation.  Prefers sand or mud substrata where it sifts for aquatic insects, especially diptera and ephemeroptera and seeds (Ref. 36880).  Spawns about 300-400 eggs at the end of the dry season, just before the wet season.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Central America:  Atlantic slope from Honduras (Patuca River) to Costa Rica.
